Institution: FSCJ - FLORIDA STATE COLLEGE AT JAX.
Statewide Course: CAPSTONE REVIEW COURSE OF ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES
Course Description: THE AS ACCOUNTING TECHNOLOGY CAPSTONE COURSE WILL ASSESS THE KNOWLEDGE LEARNED THROUGHOUT THE PROGRAM. THE COURSE WILL COVER ASPECTS OF ACCOUNTING INCLUDING ETHICS, PROFESSIONAL AUDITING, CONTEMPORARY AND PROFESSIONAL RESEARCH ISSUES AND THE ACCOUNTING PROFESSION. A COMPREHENSIVE ACCOUNTING SIMULATION MAY BE USED FOR STUDENTS TO GAIN EXPERIENCE IN ACCOUNTING AND RECORD KEEPING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
COURSE TOPICS                                       				 CONTACT HOURS
                                                     				      PER TOPIC

I.	ETHICS IN ACCOUNTING								9

II. 	PROFESSIONAL AUDITING								6

III. 	CONTEMPORARY ISSUES IN ACCOUNTING						9

IV. 	ACCOUNTING AND PROFESSIONAL RESEARCH ISSUES				6

V. 	COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW OF ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES AND METHODS		9

VI. 	ACCOUNTING PROFESSION                                                                                  6
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
